bill_title: make an appropriation of American Rescue Plan Act moneys for certain home and community-based services, and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to make an appropriation of American Rescue Plan Act moneys for certain home and community-based services, and to declare an emergency. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated the sum of $80,000,000 in federal fund expenditure authority for the expenditure of American Rescue Plan Act Section 9817 moneys, to the Department of Human Services, for the purpose of allocating the moneys to certain home and community-based services for one-time compensation adjustments, retention incentives, direct care work recruitment and training, telehealth, or assistive technology equipment. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated the sum of $13,600,000 in federal fund expenditure authority for the expenditure of American Rescue Plan Act Section 9817 moneys, to the Department of Social Services, for the purpose of allocating the moneys to certain home and community-based services for one-time compensation adjustments, retention incentives, direct care work recruitment and training, telehealth, or assistive technology equipment. Section 3. The secretary of the Department of Human Services shall approve vouchers for appropriations provided in section 1 of this act. The secretary of the Department of Social Services shall approve vouchers for appropriations provided in section 2 of this Act. The state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2026, shall revert in accordance with the procedures prescribed in chapter 4-8.

An Act to make an appropriation of American Rescue Plan Act moneys for certain home and community-based services, and to declare an emergency. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated the sum of $80,000,000 in federal fund expenditure authority for the expenditure of American Rescue Plan Act Section 9817 moneys, to the Department of Human Services, for the purpose of allocating the moneys to certain home and community-based services for one-time compensation adjustments, retention incentives, direct care work recruitment and training, telehealth, or assistive technology equipment. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated the sum of $13,600,000 in federal fund expenditure authority for the expenditure of American Rescue Plan Act Section 9817 moneys, to the Department of Social Services, for the purpose of allocating the moneys to certain home and community-based services for one-time compensation adjustments, retention incentives, direct care work recruitment and training, telehealth, or assistive technology equipment. Section 3. The secretary of the Department of Human Services shall approve vouchers for appropriations provided in section 1 of this act. The secretary of the Department of Social Services shall approve vouchers for appropriations provided in section 2 of this Act. The state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2026, shall revert in accordance with the procedures prescribed in chapter 4-8. Section 5. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.
